div._value: The Best Classic Chili - This traditional chili recipe is just like mom used to make with ground beef, beans, and a simple homemade blend of chili seasonings.

_attributes.content: The Best Chili Recipe - with ground beef, beans, and homemade chili seasoning.

span._value: red kidney beans, drained and rinsed

div._value: Add the olive oil to a large soup pot and place it over medium-high heat for two minutes.  Add the onion.  Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the ground beef to the pot.  Break it apart with a wooden spoon.  Cook for 6-7 minutes, until the beef is browned, stirring occasionally.
Add the chili powder, cumin, sugar, tomato paste, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and optional cayenne.  Stir until well combined.
Add the broth, diced tomatoes (with their juice), drained beans, and tomato sauce.  Stir well.
Bring the liquid to a low boil.  Then, reduce the heat (low to medium-low) to gently simmer the chili, uncovered, for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove the pot from the heat.  Let the chili rest for 5-10 minutes before serving.

span._value: I typically skip the cayenne pepper because I have a young kiddo.  Then, I put out some hot sauce for those adults that want to add some spiciness to their chili.

li._value: Heat olive in a large soup pot.
Add chopped onion and cook for 5 minutes.
Add ground beef and break it apart with a wooden spoon.
Add chili powder, cumin, sugar, tomato paste, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and optional cayenne.
Add diced tomatoes, kidney beans, beef broth, and tomato sauce.
Let the chili rest for 5-10 minutes before serving.

p._value: The best chili recipe! I leave out the optional cayenne. I use petite diced stewed tomatoes that come pre-seasoned in the can with cracked black pepper and olive oil. Top with sour cream and shredded old cheddar. Delish!

p._value: Awesome! I cooked it exactly as described and it was great!

_attributes.alt: 5 stars

p._value: This was quick and easy and delicious.  I had to substitute cannelini (white kidney) beans for red kidney bean and I did not drain them — all in!. I halved the cumin and the cayenne after reading comments.  The five minute resting was essential to it becoming less soupy.  Served with the great cornbread linked in the site.

_attributes.alt: 5 stars

p._value: BEST CHILI EVER! This is my go to recipe and my boyfriend and I LOVE IT! Very simple and followed the directions to a T.

_attributes.alt: 5 stars

p._value: This first  time I made it it was way too sweet, but the other flavors were spot on. So I made it again with just 2 teaspoons of sugar and it was great! This is now my go to chili recipe.

_values: I found this recipie quite by accident.  Made it and my mom LOOOOVED IT!
For me, that’s the ticket we had it with cornbread!
Thank you whomever is the poster if this delicious chili

p._value: My husband always says “this is your best yet!” every time I use this recipe 🤣. I absolutely love this recipe! It’s basic, fast, and not complicated. I’m just wondering if u would have to change anything (like add more broth) if u were to cook it in an instapot 🤔. Can u try it and lmk? Lol thanks!
I was wondering if could use sour cream &chive mashed potatoes instead of just sour cream then continue to top with what ever toppings.cheese ,bacon, jalapeños

p._value: Best chili I ever eaten!!! Every seasonings was perfect amount, I just added 1 teaspoon sugar, don’t pay attention to the  people who have always taste problems. Good job with your recipe! Thank you! It’s a keeper!

p._value: Delicious and easy to make. It’s our permanent chili recipe now!

Craving chili for this chilly day. Found this recipe  and loved all the ingredients.  Made pretty much to the T. Except did not have paste so I used a little ketchup.  Used Rotel diced chilis and tomatoes and a little extra chili powder. . We love hot.  Topped with sour cream, cheese and white onions. Love, love👍🏻

I do use packaged chili seasoning and it works well except it is a bit spicier than measuring out separate spices. Other than that I use the same ingredients. My beef is leaner 96 or 93 %… it really is delicious… and even better the next day!
